moves.1. Na3 e5 2. Nc4 Nc6 3. e4 Nf6 4. d3 d5: The starting position for all the games.
moves.11... Nf4 12. O-O: Time to tuck away the King.
moves.12... Nd4 13. Nxd4: I see no reason not to exchange.
moves.13... exd4 14. Ng4: Now a crazy tactical sequence begins.
moves.14... Nxe2+ 15. Kh1: First, I have to duck clear. Black's Knight is now stuck on K7 [if it moves, I play R-K1 pinning the Q.]
moves.15... Bxg4 16. hxg4: Black swaps off another set of minors.
moves.17... Nxg3+ 18. fxg3: By checking, Black buys time to prevent me from pinning and winning the Q.
moves.18... O-O-O 19. gxf5: After all of those fireworks, material is even.
moves.20... Bd6 21. Bf4: Cutting off the route to my King.
